nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,26 +1,27 @@
-# Map Rotation
+# Map rotation
 
 Rotate a map.
 
-![](MapRotation.png)
+![Image of map rotation](MapRotation.png)
+
+## Use case
+
+A user may wish to view the map in an orientation other than north-facing.
 
 ## How to use the sample
 
-Use the slider to rotate the map. If the map is not pointed north, the compass will display the current heading.
-Click the compass to set the map's heading to north.
+Use the slider to rotate the map.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,26 +1,27 @@
-# Map Rotation
+# Map rotation
 
 Rotate a map.
 
-![](MapRotation.png)
+![Image of map rotation](MapRotation.png)
+
+## Use case
+
+A user may wish to view the map in an orientation other than north-facing.
 
 ## How to use the sample
 
-Use the slider to rotate the map. If the map is not pointed north, the compass will display the current heading.
-Click the compass to set the map's heading to north.
+Use the slider to rotate the map.
 
 ## How it works
 
-To rotate a map:
-
-1. Create an `ArcGISMap`.
-2. Add the map to a `MapView`.
-3. Use `MapView.setViewpointRotationAsync` to indicate the rotation angle.
+1. Create a `ArcGISMap` and set it to a `MapView`.
+3. Use `setViewpointRotationAsync(...)` to set the rotation angle of the map.
